title: Washington County high school scores and top performers for April 28-May 3
description: Here are the Washington County high school scores and top performers for for the week of April 28-May 3, to be updated nightly.
excerpt: Here are the Washington County high school scores and top performers for for the week of April 28-May 3, to be updated nightly.
text: Skip to main content Washington County high school scores and top performers for the week of April 28 to May 3:Monday, April 28BaseballBoonsboro 21, Middletown 10North Hagerstown 9, Frederick 5Williamsport 6, Catoctin 4South Hagerstown 2, Thomas Johnson 1Heritage 8, Calvary 6Brunswick 12, Smithsburg 1Northern Garrett 10, Hancock 0SoftballSouth Hagerstown 9, Thomas Johnson 2Saint James 5, Potomac 1Boonsboro 3, Middletown 1Brunswick 10, Smithsburg 5Northern Garrett 11, Hancock 3Frederick 14, North Hagerstown 4James Buchanan 12, Clear Spring 2Catoctin 22, Williamsport 1Boys LacrosseMiddletown 16, Smithsburg 7Winters Mill 6, North Hagerstown 1Girls LacrosseBoonsboro 17, Brunswick 6Winters Mill 21, North Hagerstown 0Boys TennisBoonsboro 4, Middletown 1Brunswick 4, Smithsburg 1Thomas Johnson 5, South Hagerstown 0Girls TennisBoonsboro 4, Middletown 1South Hagerstown 4, Thomas Johnson 1Brunswick 4, Smithsburg 1Top performersCarter Jackson, Logan Atkinson, Darian Gaskins, Parker DeBaugh, Jeremy King and Russell Colliere, Boonsboro baseball -- Jackson had four hits, including a double, and seven RBIs, Atkinson had four hits, including a double, and three RBIs, Gaskins had three hits, including a double, and four RBIs, DeBaugh had three doubles, three RBIs and struck out five over four innings, King had two hits and two RBIs and Colliere added two hits in a win over Middletown.Lily Schlotterbeck, Tenley Mullendore and Everett Sechler, Saint James softball -- Schlotterbeck had three hits, including a double and a home run, drove in four runs and pitched a complete game, allowing one unearned run on four hits and two walks while striking out 18. Mullendore and Sechler added two hits each in a win over Potomac.Addison Tyler, Mylee Hartman and McKenna Johnson, Boonsboro softball -- Tyler allowed one run on three hits and two walks while striking out 11, Hartman had three hits, including a double, and Johnson added two hits in a win over Middletown.Kaelynn Kunkle, Kenzie Lamer, Chelsea Desmond, Kailia Burke and Raelee Fry, South Hagerstown softball -- Kunkle hit a two-run homer, Lamer homered, Desmond hit two doubles, Burke had two hits, including a double, and two RBIs, and Fry pitched a complete game with seven strikeouts and added an RBI double in a win over Thomas Johnson.James Ortiz, Eli Brown, Colt Tucker, Matt Mallardi, Joey Dorsey and Jackson Coulter, North Hagerstown baseball -- Ortiz, Brown and Tucker had two hits each, Mallardi had a double and three RBIs, Dorsey hit an RBI triple and Coulter struck out seven over five innings in a win over Frederick.Caleb Wise, Aden Cole, Stephen Reno, Titus Britner and Noah Poe, Heritage baseball -- Wise had two hits, including a triple, and two RBIs, Cole had two hits, including a double, and struck out seven over five innings, Reno had two hits and two RBIs, and Britner and Poe added two hits each in a win over Calvary.Jared Dangerfield and Nate Bowman, Williamsport baseball -- Dangerfield hit a two-run homer and Bowman added two hits in a win over Catoctin.Cam Kelley, South Hagerstown baseball -- Allowed one run on one hit and six walks while striking out six over five innings in a win over Thomas Johnson.Halie Hughes and McKinsey Baker, North Hagerstown softball -- Hughes doubled, homered and drove in four runs, and Baker added two hits, including a double, in a loss to Frederick.Jaimie Cuevas, Lizzy Cox and Kimberly Hebert, Smithsburg softball -- Cuevas doubled and homered, Cox had two hits and Hebert struck out nine in a loss to Brunswick.Raegan Domer, Clear Spring softball -- Homered in a loss to James Buchanan.Ayden Weakfall, Zach Linn, Blake Linn and Dante Rucci, Smithsburg boys lacrosse -- Weakfall had two goals and two assists, Zach Linn scored twice, Blake Linn had a goal and three assists, and Rucci made 14 saves in a loss to Middletown.Brooklyn McCusker and Sydney True, Hancock softball -- McCusker had two hits and True drove in two runs in a loss to Northern Garrett. html:
Skip to main content

Washington County high school scores and top performers for the week of April 28 to May 3:

Monday, April 28

Baseball

Boonsboro 21, Middletown 10

North Hagerstown 9, Frederick 5

Williamsport 6, Catoctin 4

South Hagerstown 2, Thomas Johnson 1

Heritage 8, Calvary 6

Brunswick 12, Smithsburg 1

Northern Garrett 10, Hancock 0

Softball

South Hagerstown 9, Thomas Johnson 2

Saint James 5, Potomac 1

Boonsboro 3, Middletown 1

Brunswick 10, Smithsburg 5

Northern Garrett 11, Hancock 3

Frederick 14, North Hagerstown 4

James Buchanan 12, Clear Spring 2

Catoctin 22, Williamsport 1

Boys Lacrosse

Middletown 16, Smithsburg 7

Winters Mill 6, North Hagerstown 1

Girls Lacrosse

Boonsboro 17, Brunswick 6

Winters Mill 21, North Hagerstown 0

Boys Tennis

Boonsboro 4, Middletown 1

Brunswick 4, Smithsburg 1

Thomas Johnson 5, South Hagerstown 0

Girls Tennis

Boonsboro 4, Middletown 1

South Hagerstown 4, Thomas Johnson 1

Brunswick 4, Smithsburg 1

Top performers

  • Carter Jackson, Logan Atkinson, Darian Gaskins, Parker DeBaugh, Jeremy King and Russell Colliere, Boonsboro baseball -- Jackson had four hits, including a double, and seven RBIs, Atkinson had four hits, including a double, and three RBIs, Gaskins had three hits, including a double, and four RBIs, DeBaugh had three doubles, three RBIs and struck out five over four innings, King had two hits and two RBIs and Colliere added two hits in a win over Middletown.
  • Lily Schlotterbeck, Tenley Mullendore and Everett Sechler, Saint James softball -- Schlotterbeck had three hits, including a double and a home run, drove in four runs and pitched a complete game, allowing one unearned run on four hits and two walks while striking out 18. Mullendore and Sechler added two hits each in a win over Potomac.
  • Addison Tyler, Mylee Hartman and McKenna Johnson, Boonsboro softball -- Tyler allowed one run on three hits and two walks while striking out 11, Hartman had three hits, including a double, and Johnson added two hits in a win over Middletown.
  • Kaelynn Kunkle, Kenzie Lamer, Chelsea Desmond, Kailia Burke and Raelee Fry, South Hagerstown softball -- Kunkle hit a two-run homer, Lamer homered, Desmond hit two doubles, Burke had two hits, including a double, and two RBIs, and Fry pitched a complete game with seven strikeouts and added an RBI double in a win over Thomas Johnson.
  • James Ortiz, Eli Brown, Colt Tucker, Matt Mallardi, Joey Dorsey and Jackson Coulter, North Hagerstown baseball -- Ortiz, Brown and Tucker had two hits each, Mallardi had a double and three RBIs, Dorsey hit an RBI triple and Coulter struck out seven over five innings in a win over Frederick.
  • Caleb Wise, Aden Cole, Stephen Reno, Titus Britner and Noah Poe, Heritage baseball -- Wise had two hits, including a triple, and two RBIs, Cole had two hits, including a double, and struck out seven over five innings, Reno had two hits and two RBIs, and Britner and Poe added two hits each in a win over Calvary.
  • Jared Dangerfield and Nate Bowman, Williamsport baseball -- Dangerfield hit a two-run homer and Bowman added two hits in a win over Catoctin.
  • Cam Kelley, South Hagerstown baseball -- Allowed one run on one hit and six walks while striking out six over five innings in a win over Thomas Johnson.
  • Halie Hughes and McKinsey Baker, North Hagerstown softball -- Hughes doubled, homered and drove in four runs, and Baker added two hits, including a double, in a loss to Frederick.
  • Jaimie Cuevas, Lizzy Cox and Kimberly Hebert, Smithsburg softball -- Cuevas doubled and homered, Cox had two hits and Hebert struck out nine in a loss to Brunswick.
  • Raegan Domer, Clear Spring softball -- Homered in a loss to James Buchanan.
  • Ayden Weakfall, Zach Linn, Blake Linn and Dante Rucci, Smithsburg boys lacrosse -- Weakfall had two goals and two assists, Zach Linn scored twice, Blake Linn had a goal and three assists, and Rucci made 14 saves in a loss to Middletown.
  • Brooklyn McCusker and Sydney True, Hancock softball -- McCusker had two hits and True drove in two runs in a loss to Northern Garrett.
